hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Rushaid ibn Malik al-Sa'di: I was with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ one day when a man came with a plate of dates and asked: 'Is this charity or a gift?' The man said: 'Rather, it is charity.' He said: 'Present it to the people.' And al-Hasan was rolling about before him, so he took a date and put it in his mouth. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ looked at him and inserted his finger in his mouth and withdrew the date and threw it away, then said: 'We, the Family of Muhammad, do not eat charity'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Fujay' al-'Amiri: He came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and asked: 'What from dead animals is permissible for us?' He said: 'What is your food?' They said: 'We drink milk in the morning and evening.' Uqba explained it to me (meaning): A drink in the morning and a drink in the evening. He said: 'That and by my father, from hunger.' So he permitted them the dead animal on this condition

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Attab ibn Shumir's father: I said to the Prophet ﷺ: 'O Messenger of Allah, I have an elderly father and siblings. I go to them hoping they might convert, so I might bring them to you.' He said: 'If they convert, it is good for them. If they remain (as they are), then Islam is vast, or wide'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Jawshan ibn Rabi'a al-Kilabi came to the Prophet ﷺ and gifted him a horse while he was still a polytheist. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ refused to accept it from him. He said: 'If you wish, sell it to me for the fine armors from Badr.' Then he said to him: 'O Dhu al-Jawshan, would you like to be among the first of this matter?' He said: 'No.' He said: 'What prevents you from it?' He replied: 'I saw your people denied you, expelled you, and fought you, so I am waiting. If you prevail over them, I will believe in you and follow you. If they prevail over you, I will not follow you.' So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: 'O Dhu al-Jawshan, perhaps if you remain near I will see my triumph over them.' Then he said: 'By Allah, I was in a neighborhood when a rider from Makkah came to us. We asked: What news do you bring? He said: Muhammad has prevailed over the people of Makkah. So Dhu al-Jawshan grieved over his leaving Islam when the Messenger of Allah ﷺ called him to it'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Dhu al-Jawshan al-Dibabi: I came to the Prophet ﷺ after he finished with Badr, and I said: O Messenger of Allah, I have brought you the son of al-Qarha (the mare), so take him. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: No, and if you wish I would give you in exchange for it the best of the armors from Badr, I did it. I said: I would not exchange your horse for armor today

hadiths.english_translation: Others besides Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shayba narrated this hadith more completely from Isa ibn Yunus, from his father, that he narrated to him from his grandfather, from Dhu al-Jawshan al-Dibabi: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ after he finished with the people of Badr, with the son of a horse of mine called al-Qarha'. I said: O Muhammad, I have come to you with the son of al-Qarha' for you to use. He said: I have no need for it. Then he said: O Dhu al-Jawshan, will you not accept Islam and be among the first of this matter? He said: No. He said: Then I said: I saw your people were obsessed with you. He said: How did you hear about their deaths at Badr? I said: It reached me. He said: Then I promise you this if you conquer the Ka'bah and its covering. He said: Perhaps if you live you will see that. Then he said: O Bilal, take the man's pack, provision him from the date paste. He said: When I turned away, he said: Indeed, he is the best horseman of Bani Amir. He said: By Allah, I was with my family at al-'Ud when a rider came to us. I said: What do the people do? He said: By Allah, Muhammad has conquered the Ka'bah and its covering. He said: I said: May my mother grieve for me, and had I converted that day, then asked him for al-Hira, he would have given it to me

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ghalib ibn Abjar: A famine afflicted us and I had nothing in my wealth to feed my family except the fat of my donkeys, and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ had prohibited the meat of domestic donkeys. I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said: O Messenger of Allah, a famine has afflicted us and I have nothing in my wealth to feed my family except the fat of my donkeys, and you have prohibited the meat of domestic donkeys. He said: Feed your family from the fat of your donkeys. I only prohibited them because of the village wanderers

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by 'Affan ibn Muslim: From Shu'bah, from 'Amr ibn Murrah, who said: I heard Abu Burdah say: I heard a man from Juhaynah called al-Agharr, who was one of the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), speaking and claiming that he heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: 'O people! Repent to your Lord, for indeed I repent one hundred times a day.'

Narrated by Unknown: [Arabic: من بني الحارث بن كعب . $7112 7113]

Narrated by al-Fadl ibn Dukayn: From Qays ibn al-Rabi', from al-Miqdam ibn Shurayh, from his father, from his grandfather Hani' ibn Yazid that he came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) in a delegation from Banu al-Harith. He said: He used to be known as Abu al-Hakam. He said: They kept calling him Abu al-Hakam. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Why do they call you Abu al-Hakam?' He said: Because when there is a dispute among them, they come to me and I judge between them. He said: 'Do you have children?' I said: Yes. He said: 'Which of them is the oldest?' I said: Shurayh. He said: 'Then you are Abu Shurayh.'
